column1: Their most prized possession is an old coin that has no monetary value.
They have an irrational fear of pigeons.
As a kid they always wanted to be a horse when they grew up.
Their favorite word is squelch.
Their favorite number is 17.
They can turn their eyelids inside out.
They used to have a pet cat called Ser Woofington - it barked like a dog.
They always knock on wooden door frames thrice before passing through them.
They refuse to drink from any tankard not made of bone, they always carry a spare just in case.
They once broke the record for fastest person to drink a whole barrel of ale - by half an hour.
They love making tiny model beasts, which they leave hidden everywhere they go.
They collect flowers and press them into tiny glass frames.
They hate the sound of people sneezing.
Hearing someone chew their food sends them into fits of anger.
They speak 8 different languages. (Everyone else thinks at least one of these is not a real language.)
They bake the best cookies in all the land.
They are the youngest of 12 siblings.
They are allergic to strawberries.
They are practically addicted to peanut butter.
They have a tattoo that no-one has ever seen - and no-one ever will.
Their favorite color is purple.
They have broken 8 different bones in their body.
They have a really bad habit of cracking their knuckles.
They suspiciously refuse to wear or touch silver and will not answer any questions about it.
They have a pet owl that occasionally nests in their hair.
They can’t stand the taste of salt.
They have an unusually long toe, but not an important one.
Occasionally strangers will approach them and call them by a name no-one else recognises.
They always carry a small plant in a glass bottle.
They have a large mole in the shape of a foot just below their right shoulder blade.
They only ever refer to themselves in third person.
They are a surprisingly adept sailor.
They are ambidextrous, but only while drunk.
They hate when their feet are touched.
They have a fear of the word moist.
They have a scaly thigh from an encounter years ago with a mysterious stranger.
They always wear weighted shoes to ensure good walking legs.
They can bench press two dwarves.
They are deaf in their right ear - they won’t tell anyone how this happened.
They can solve a Rubik’s cube in under 2 minutes - blindfolded.
They wear a metal mask at all times even when sleeping - no-one has ever seen their face.
They have never once considered gravity.
They secretly wish they had wings.
They once tried to make friends with a badger
column2: but it didn't go very well...

column1: They have always wanted to
column2: but never tried to hop on one leg.

column1: They are lactose intolerant but live their life like they are not.
They always turn up 5 minutes late.
They are deaf in one ear.
They are married.
They are a twin.
They have a fake treasure map that they believe leads to real treasure.
They are not capable of concentrating on two things at once.
They always keep a bag of beans on their person.
They carry around a teddy bear that they protect with their life.
They will choose to eat fresh grass before any other food.
They have a pet of your choice named Gerald.
No matter how hard they try
column2: they will never be able to whistle.

column1: They have a bad relationship with their mother.
They are obsessed with the feeling of cotton.
They can't help but end every sentence with the word 'duh'.
They can't help but laugh in morose situations.
They have larger than average feet.
They are incredibly clumsy.
They accidentally ate some mushrooms that gave them a sense of euphoria
column2: and have been chasing that high ever since.

column1: They have no understanding of authority or social hierarchies.
They get frustrated when they see the color green
column2: and will do whatever they can to get away from it.

column1: They feel revolted when they see blood.
They constantly have a headache.
They have never been in a fulfilling relationship.
They have never been told where meat comes from
column2: and would be deeply saddened if anyone dared tell them.

column1: They once wished upon a star and nothing happened
column2: and now they don't believe stars exist.

column1: They have never found the true meaning of Christmas.
They cannot leave the house without a piece of cheese in their pocket.
Every time someone sneezes
column2: they don't say bless you

column1: They fully believe that they don't have arms
column2: they have tentacles.

column1: They believe they are a skeleton that is in control of a meat suit.
They lose their posessions all the time.
They don't know who their dad is.
They once adopted an orphan
column2: but changed their mind and sent it back.

column1: They do not like wearing socks.
They collect shiny rocks that they like on the ground.
They make crab hands when they are excited.
They are a compulsive shopper
column2: anything they like they will immediately want to buy.

column1: They are a compulsive gambler.
They have a pet rock that they believe is sentient.
They have expensive taste
column2: and refuse to eat anything that isn't worth at least 5 gold pieces.

column1: They believe the more money they throw down a well
column2: the more likely the wish is to come true.

column1: They only have to hear a song once to remember every single lyric.
They are terrible at singing and can break glass with a high enough pitch
They hate the feeling of silk.
If they see a rainbow they will make every effort to get to the other side of it
column2: to collect their pot of gold.

column1: They have never broken a bone and therefore believe that they are invinsible.
Their lifes purpose is to taste the best cheese
column2: and will buy any new cheese to see if it is better than the last.

column1: at any moment
column2: they may just blurt out a random thought from their brain

column1: when coming up with plans
column2: they will think of the plan in their brains
column3: and only say the final part out loud.

column1: They sing a special song they kill.
They are a pasifist but they will kill if it is a last resort.
They apologise to grass when it looks to be damaged.
They refuse to yawn in front of people.
They have an awkward crush on every other member of the party.
When they snore
column2: it instead creates the sound of chiming bells.

column1: Whenever they are victorious
column2: they make the sound 'hghu-hu!'

column1: Every time they interact with a duck they quack back
column2: believing that they can speak duck.

column1: If there is time
column2: they will always dance in the remains of their dead enemies.

column1: They have an extra set of teeth behind their original
column2: like a shark.
